meanings.sent1: I was bejumbling the puzzle pieces, trying to fit them together.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys bejumbling different ingredients to create unique dishes.
meanings.sent3: The magician bejumbled the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were bejumbled like a tangled ball of yarn.
meanings.sent5: The teacher bejumbled the students by rearranging their seating chart unexpectedly.

meanings.definition: The act of mixing up or confusing (noun)
meanings.sent1: The bejumbling of the files led to a lot of confusion in the office.
meanings.sent2: His bejumbling of the directions caused us to get lost on the hike.
meanings.sent3: The bejumbling of the colors in the painting created an interesting abstract effect.
meanings.sent4: The bejumbling of the words in the poem added a layer of complexity to its meaning.
meanings.sent5: The bejumbling of the schedule resulted in chaos during the event.
